entry.title: Burger

entry.title: Kiwifruit
entry.content:
Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.

The most common cultivar group of kiwifruit is oval, about the size of a largehen’s egg (5–8 cm (2.0–3.1 in) in length and 4.5–5.5 cm (1.8–2.2 in) indiameter). It has a fibrous, dull greenish-brown skin and bright green orgolden flesh with rows of tiny, black, edible seeds. The fruit has a soft texture, with a sweet and unique flavor. his forces the writer to use creativity to complete one of three common writing challenges. entry.title: Apples
entry.content:
An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

Apple trees are cultivated worldwide, and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus. The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor, Malus sieversii, is still found today. Apples have been grown for thousands of years in Asia and Europe, and were brought to North America by European colonists.Generating random paragraphs can be an excellent way for writers to get their creative flow going at the beginning of the day. entry.title: Banans
entry.content:
A banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called “plantains”,distinguishing them from dessert bananas. The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich instarch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.his forces the writer to use creativity to complete one of three common writing challenges.
